snippet: A state judge said the rule requiring vaccination against the disease for anyone to attend a city-licensed preschool or day care center was invalid without action by the Legislature.
abstract: New York State Supreme Court Justice Manuel J Mendez rules New York City health department cannot require flu vaccinations of children attending city-licensed preschools and day care centers without action by State Legislature specifying influenza as disease requiring immunization; ruling strikes down one of Bloomberg administration's signature public health initiatives.
lead_paragraph: A state judge said the rule requiring vaccination against the disease for anyone to attend a city-licensed preschool or day care center was invalid without action by the Legislature.

headline.main: New York City’s Flu Shot Mandate for Young Children Is Struck Down
headline.print_headline: Judge Halts City’s Flu-Shot Mandate for Children, Saying It Bypassed Albany
